head.title: An American Town Meeting: The Issue Is Race; The Cubans

hedline.hl1: An American Town Meeting: The Issue Is Race; The Cubans

abstract.p: Miriam Ocasio, letter, responds to June 5 article Best of Friends, Worlds Apart, in series How Race Is Lived in America; laments racist attitudes learned by white Cuban immigrants to US

block.p: Re ''Best of Friends, Worlds Apart'' (front page, June 5):

Re ''Best of Friends, Worlds Apart'' (front page, June 5):
Your article clearly shows that racism is a phenomenon that exists to a great extent on the basis of a person's skin color.
It also shows how white minorities, like some Cubans, come here and are socialized to feel superior to those with darker skin, including their own compatriots.

What's even more disheartening is that people like Achmed Valdes, the white Cuban immigrant featured in the article, assert on the one hand, ''It's not that I'm racist,'' but on the other refer to most blacks as ''delinquents'' and people who ''basically have kids and go on welfare.''
Until Mr. Valdes and other white people who think like him take responsibility for ending racism, this disease will be incurable.
